text: Hi Ben, sorry for the slow response, it's been a really busy few weeks! I certainly think that quantity surveying and finance can overlap and quantity surveying is a good career choice.

I think my favourite thing about finance is that you can take the core skills (e.g. reading financial information) and apply your ideas and understanding to almost any sector, there is so much overlap. My background originally was in the insurance market, now I work in Sport & Leisure, so it allows you to transition to an industry you enjoy because you have the core skills.

I also think in finance, you meet so many different people with different backgrounds, there isn't one set of skills that everyone should have. I have met people from sport, music, politics who have all moved into a finance career. You need different skills from various backgrounds to come together as a team to solve problems for clients.
So if you do go into quantity surveying, then you are not closing the door on finance and that degree shows you have a strong numerical background.
